messages.title: More steps to a fairer Britain
messages.content: Our RECORD OF ACTION: We cut the deficit in half and helped firms create 1.8 million new jobs with apprenticeships. We forced Osborne to bring in an £800 tax cut for 25 million earners. Protected pupil premiums of £2.5 billion a year and free school meals for younger children. Increased the NHS budget, with 6,000 more doctors than in 2010. Our PROMISE OF MORE: We will finish the job of balancing the books, as fairly as possible. The richest should pay more. Cut Income Tax by a further £400 for ordinary workers. We'll protect education spending and equality of opportunity. We oppose two tier exams or schools. We'll raise NHS spending by £8bn & guarantee mental health equality.

messages.title: 3 great reasons to vote for Ade Adeyemo
messages.content: A local man with a record of delivery. A strong voice who will put Meriden 'back on the map'. A fresh start for effective community representation for local people.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Lib Dems are green - but practical. We've favoured the 'Trains confront climate change with a Green Deal, more renewable power and rail electrification. We support five new Green Laws to protect the environment so Britain can be prosperous, sustainable, and carbon neutral.
'I have witnessed first-hand the devastating human cost of failure to deal with mental health'. Thanks to the Lib Dems this is changing - Lee Dargue.
Two million apprenticeships are helping young people and workers thrive. Vince Cable has made this happen - we have a record to be proud of.
'I notice the difference since the Income Tax cut. My pay slip each month has a figure for school meals and free school checks which is good - for me and the family budget.'

issues.environment: Britain can be prosperous, sustainable, and carbon neutral.
issues.health: Increased the NHS budget, with 6,000 more doctors than in 2010. We'll raise NHS spending by £8bn & guarantee mental health equality.

leaflet.personalStatement: Ade says, 'My home is here and we must work very hard to keep it a place we are proud to call home.'
